    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)

      • move

        public void move(java.lang.String direction)
        Moves the game character in the direction passed. Does not move if the next position is taken by a wall or has a negative coordinate.
        Parameters:
        direction - Direction to move ("LEFT", "RIGHT", "UP", "DOWN").

      • setX

        public void setX(int newX)
        Sets the value of x to newX.
        Parameters:
        newX - X coordinate.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the value of x.
        Returns:
        The value of x.

      • setY

        public void setY(int newY)
        Sets the value of y to newY.
        Parameters:
        newY - Y coordinate.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the value of y.
        Returns:
        The value of y.

      • getNextPosInDirection

        public Position getNextPosInDirection(java.lang.String direction)
        Returns the position that the game character would be if they moved in the direction passed.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to move in.
        Returns:
        The next position.

      • setFacing

        public void setFacing(java.lang.String direction)
        Sets the value of facing.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to look.

      • getFacing

        public java.lang.String getFacing()
        Gets the value of facing.
        Returns:
        The direction that the game character is facing.

      • setLastFacing

        public void setLastFacing(java.lang.String direction)
        Sets the value of lastFacing.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction faced in the previous frame.

      • getLastFacing

        public java.lang.String getLastFacing()
        Gets the value of lastFacing.
        Returns:
        The direction faced in the previous frame.

      • incrementFrame

        public int incrementFrame()
        Increments the frameInterval by 1. Resets frameInterval to 1 if it is equal to 60.
        Returns:
        The new value of frameInterval.

      • updateSprite

        public void updateSprite()
        Changes the value of sprite based on the spriteCount, and then increments the spriteCount. If sprite is null then return.

      • checkCollisions

        public boolean checkCollisions(int nextX,
                               int nextY)
        Checks if there is a solid wall tile or broken wall tile in the position passed.
        Parameters:
        nextX - X coordinate to check
        nextY - Y coordinate to check
        Returns:
        Whether or not a solid or broken wall tile was found.

      • checkExplosion

        public boolean checkExplosion()
        Checks and returns if the game character has been hit by an explosion.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the game character was hit by an explosion.
